oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Hot corrosion of YSZ/Al(2)O(3) dispersed NiCrAlY plasma-sprayed coatings in Na(2)SO(4)-10 wt.% NaCl melt
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SREEDHAR, G
RAJA, VS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: thermal barrier coatings
yttria-stabilized zirconia
nondestructive evaluation
oxidation behavior
residual-stress
resistance
piezospectroscopy
microstructure
superalloy
powders
metal coatings
molten salts
hot corrosion
kinetics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study examines the effect of ytrria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) dispersion on hot corrosion behaviour of NiCrAlY bond coat. Hot corrosion studies were conducted on NiCrAlY and NiCrAlY containing 25, 50 and 75 wt.% YSZ coatings obtained through the air plasma spray technique, in Na(2)SO(4) + 10 wt.% NaCl environment at 800 degrees C. The results show that YSZ dispersion lowers the overall hot corrosion tendency of the NiCrAlY, though it enhances the inherent hot corrosion tendency of its metallic constituent (NiCrAlY). Furthermore, there exists a threshold oxide level beyond which it adversely affects the hot corrosion of the coating.
